Introduction ¶

The code below is all you need to get started with single CouchDB server.

var couchdb = require("couchdb-api");

/** default values: "localhost", 5984 **/
var server = couchdb.srv(host, port);

// or you can use the bare constructor...
var server = new couchdb.Server(host, port);

Information ¶

GET / official documentation

Returns basic meta information about the server. (including version number)

server.info(function (err, response) {
	// your code here...
});

All Databases ¶

GET /_all_dbs official documentation

Returns a list of all the available databases on this server.

server.allDbs(function (err, dbs) {
	// your code here...
});

Active Tasks ¶

GET /_active_tasks official documentation

Returns information about the tasks currently running on the server.

server.activeTasks(function (err, tasks) {
	// your code here...
});

Log ¶

GET /_log official documentation

Returns the contents of the server's log file.

Additional Arguments *

name data type comments
query object Querystring parameters to add to the request uri.
(see CouchDB documentation for specifics)

* callback is always assumed to be the last argument. See this page for more details regarding callbacks.

var query = {
	bytes: 1000, // default
	offset: 0    // default
};

server.log(query, function (err, log) {
	// your code here...
});

UUIDs ¶

GET /_uuids official documentation

Retrieve a list of UUIDs generated by the server.

NOTE: The response from the server is being intercepted here and sending only the uuids property from the response, rather than the entire response.

Additional Arguments *

name data type default comments
count number 1 Number of UUIDs to request from the server (default: 1)

* callback is always assumed to be the last argument. See this page for more details regarding callbacks.

server.uuids(count, function (err, uuids) {
	// your code here...
});
